name: The Cliffs Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is beautiful — the website photos do not lie. The staff is unfailingly polite. They are genuinely nice, and always made sure we had bottled water whenever we took our car out. They helped us anyway they could, from telling us where to see the Monarch butterflies to recommending wineries.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

reviews.text: The room was well appointed — a nice-sized refrigerator, which we appreciated. I am very glad we upgraded to a "King with partial view" room on the fourth floor. The view was beautiful and serene. We could see the breakers — and hear them — from bed.
reviews.title: What a gem!

reviews.text: The scrumptious hot breakfast at the adjacent Marisol restaurant was far more than we ever expected — a cook-to-order omelette station in addition to hot items. The baked goods were nice and fresh, too.
reviews.title: fantastic view and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hope to go again soon!
reviews.title: A Fabulous Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We won this stay through an auction and are so glad we did or we may never have found out about it. We've passed through Pismo a million times and have never stopped. We stayed here for a night before the holidays and it was wonderful. The front desk was very welcoming and responsive. We had an ocean view room and could sit on our balcony and watch and listen to the winter surf. There are several surf spots within walking distance and a nice pathway in front of the hotel. The property has its own restaurant where we had a very good breakfast. During the holidays they offer crafting and movies for kids and my daughter loved that. The young woman running the crafts was a student from Cal Poly and excellent with kids. The pool is located at the rear of the property next to the ocean and they keep it quite warm, which was nice since it was rainy when we went and we were still able to swim. The hot tub is spacious and hot! The hotel seems a little older, but it is very well run and clean. Since their pool area is so welcoming with a fire pit, view, etc. I could hear chatter during the evening since our room was facing this area and could see how it might be hard to sleep if it was peak season, so you might want to request a room off to the side if you have a family and go to sleep early. We will definitely return for more than a night next time and maybe even make it an annual tradition to go for some r&r during the busy holiday season. We arrived with colds and went home feeling rejuventated. Thanks, Cliffs.
reviews.title: the Cliffs Resort and the Ocean were a delight...

reviews.text: We already plan to return. As we prepared to check out, the sun was shining, a band was playing great tunes on the (ocean front) restaurant patio, the ocean view was spectacular... it was tough leaving our balcony and room! Very nice rooms, pool, jacuzzi, and grounds. Loved the comfy bed, lovely linens, and the all-marble bath. Thought the lobby just a bit dated though. Didn't utilize any spa services. The food was fantastic - great breakfasts (oh the muffins), had delicious and beautiful meals & cocktails overlooking the Pacific - indoors and out. We found the handsome staff to be friendly, professional, helpful, and knowledgeable about the area and fun things to do. Great location, walkable to a perfect beach, other restaurants, hotels, and to a trailhead. Looking forward to our return.
reviews.title: Didn't want to leave!

reviews.text: For their price, and their location I expected more from this place. It looks like an early 80's remodeled badly. The elevators "jolt", when they start, and the common area carpets are worn out. The rooms are well decorated and roomy enough, but the bathrooms have a single sink, low ceilings, inefficient exhaust fans, TERRIBLE showerheads, and a BREVITY OF HOT WATER. The upside of this place is the view (if you get a view room), good internet, beach access, nice pool and spa, and a decent restaurant next door. Cold showers however... not so nice.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: Amazing value for what you get -- I had a huge room with fireplace overlooking the ocean. Stunning spot to stop on your drive up the CA coastline. The staff was very friendly and accommodating also.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: I would highly recommend staying here, as the views are gorgeous, and the rooms are fantastic.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: This is a fabulous place to experience the Pacific Coast. We had a room overlooking the pool and the ocean; and, it was spectacular. There is a stairway that leads down to the beach. The food at the hotel restaurant is delicious; and, in addition to free WiFi, laundry facilities are provided free of charge (except for cost of detergent) as a service to hotel guests.
reviews.title: Best in the USA

reviews.text: I stayed here while attending a conference and was very happy with this hotel. Overall, it is a very nice place to stay. The people are great, the rooms are comfortable, and the views can't be beat. The staff did a good job catering lunches and snacks for the conference. I didn't have time to take advantage of the pool, but it looked nice. The patio outside the restaurant is a wonderful place to hang out and watch the sunset.
reviews.title: Great place for a conference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside for this hotel (and all the hotels in along this stretch of coastline) is that it is close to the freeway - there isn't much land between the mountain and the ocean, so everything is close to the freeway. This is only really a problem if your room faces inland - toward the mountain and the freeway - noise can be a problem and the view isn't good. Freeway noise isn't even noticable if your room faces toward the ocean though.
reviews.title: Awesome views and great service!

reviews.text: This hotel has very spacious rooms with modern bedding and furniture. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. Anything we needed was taken care of immediately. The onsite restaurant is okay, but there are lots of great nearby restaurants in San Luis Obispo and Pismo, so this is not a drawback. The Shell Beach area of Pismo has beautiful views and the sunset view from our room was awesome! The rates paid were a good value for what we got.
reviews.title: I'll be back for sure!

reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Cliffs Resort in Pismo Beach. The ocean view is spectacular. The rooms were even better than we expected - large, nicely designed, great bathroom with a spa tub. My husband & daughter had an event to attend but I was quite happy in the room. Room Service had good dinner options, lovely wine and it arrived very quickly with excellent service. We also appreciated the gift shop. I've been to gift shops at large hotels that actually didn't carry any of the toiletries a traveler-on-the-go may have forgotten. My husband picked up a swim suit (which he forgot) there. My daughter and I also went to the spa for a massage & facial which were both wonderful. I also loved the staff - very, very friendly and happy.
reviews.title: Amazing beach cliff views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This has some of the most amazing cliff beach views that are breathtaking. Seeing a sunset over the cliffs is a must. The staff was very helpful and provided free drink coupons for the resturant on site.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Room, Great View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely worth it to get the ocean view. Room has balcony overlooking the ocean, and at night ou can hear the sound of the waves.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bed very comfortable. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Breakfast buffet very good.
reviews.title: The Cliffs at Shell Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our fourth time to stay here and we have always had a great experience. The staff is very accomomodating and the restaurant, Marisol, is excellent. We are able to take our dog and she loves it too.
reviews.title: A lovely, relaxing get-away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room, a suite, with an ocean view and balcony exceeded our expectations. It was large, clean, comfortable and well maintained. The bathroom was spacious, well lit with large mirrors and had a jacuzzi tub. The first night after strolling on the walk along the cliffs, listening to the crashing waves enjoying the fresh salty air, we watched a beautiful sunset from our balcony. The next morning we spent relaxing by the pool, swimming (the pool was a perfect temperature) and sitting the in the whirlpool. The weather was so nice that we didn't go to the fitness center or spa but instead walked down to the beach and strolled along the oceanside watching the surfers. At the hotel every staff person we encountered smiled, said hello and made us feel welcome. When we asked how to get to the Monarch Butterflies the staff was prepared with written instructions for us. The breakfast buffet was very good with a large variety of food, eggs made to order and delicious muffins. We had a perfectly enjoyable and relaxing mini vacation and did not want to leave. We plan to return in the Spring.
reviews.title: The perfect spot to stay when visiting SLO

reviews.text: If you want the perfect spot to relax, spend time walking on the beach, hike a mountain trail that overlooks the coast, or do some wine tasting near San Luis Obispo the Cliffs is it! We spent 2 nights and 3 days at the resort and didn’t want to leave. The accommodations were upscale and the facility was in the perfect place to enjoy a relaxing weekend. We were only 10 minutes from SLO and were able to visit and take in the city.
reviews.title: Beautiful Setting, Room, But Mediocre Service

description: Oceanfront full-service resort with sweeping ocean views, beautifully located 100 feet above Shell & Pismo Beaches. Deluxe guest rooms with private balcony and mountain, pool or ocean views. Complimentary Friday night wine and cheese reception and Kids Club seasonally. Heated, outdoor oceanfront pool, Spa services and 24-hour fitness center. Full service restaurant with room service, focusing on fresh, local produce and providers, as well as an oceanfront lounge with Happy Hour specials Monday through Friday. Live music select days throughout the year.
